channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Tree has fallen on pavement in front of 30 Langdon Road. Blocks all pedestrian access/, 29th September
item.description:
At 6.45pm on Sunday 29 September, a tree that was growing out of the pavement fell down, blocking the pavement on the north side of Langond Road. The tree was roughly 20 feet tall, so the blockage of the pavement is total.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Langdon Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Near the children’s park the manhole cover has sunken and appears cracked. It could be a significant hazzard, 29th September
item.description:
The what three words address is https://w3w.co/nation.tilt.acted It is on the grass just past the children’s play park towards the school.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Typhoon Way, Brockworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Fallen tree from council land on to private residence., 29th September
item.description:
A tree from the open land between Pitt Mill Grds and Millfields has fallen into our garden. This is a large mature tree that is now blocking access to areas of our garden. It’s is also causing damage to plants, walls and fencing. Please can this be removed from our property ASAP

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Millfields, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pipe to small for brook, 29th September
item.description:
The pipe that is situated at 70/72/72 A appears to be insufficient and is causing flooding at the 3 properties and needs to be reviewed by building control and the relevant body’s and they all flooded during Thursday 26th & Friday 27th’s floods.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 72, Evesham Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Completely blocked drain on Church Walk, on lane outside number 3,now with weeds growing out, 29th September
item.description:
The drain is outside number 3, Church Walk, Charlton Kings. It's the only drain in the vicinity so very easy to find. As it's situated on a slope all rain water from the footpath passes over this drain and on to the river at the bottom of the footpath. Sitll completely blocked after reporting back in May.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Walk, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping of wood and Rubbish in Layby / passing place, 29th September
item.description:
The location is a layby / passing place on the left hand side of the Cleeve Common Road about 150 yards before the Pylons Car Park. The tip consists of wood and rubbish and was done on the Saturday Night (probably). There are nails present so could be a hazard to vehicles. Please can it be cleared up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping of wooden pallet and wood, 29th September
item.description:
The location is on the Cotswold Way part of the Aggs Hill Road - on the right hand side about 20 yards from the Cotswold Way track entrance towards the Burnt Oak. The wood has nails in it so could be a traffic hazard if distributed about. Please can it be cleared up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham
